The "Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2013" amends the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act by revising the table of contents and enhancing the supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies. The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is amended to enhance the supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to subject bank holding companies to enhanced supervision and prudential standards by the Board of Governors if they pose a threat to the financial stability of the United States. The Council will use indicator-based measurement approach to assess bank holding companies based on size, interconnectedness, substitutes availability, global activity, and complexity. Subsection (d) is amended to include additional subsections for supervision and prudential standards. The text chunk describes amendments to subsections (e) through (i) of a regulatory document. Amendments are made to various sections of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, including changes to reporting requirements and mitigation measures for financial institutions. Subsection references are broadened and renumbered in the regulatory document. Amendments to the Dodd-Frank Act include expanding subsection references and renumbering sections for financial institutions. The Office of Financial Research's requirements are updated to include institutions determined under section 113. SEC. 4. REVISIONS TO BOARD AUTHORITY. (a) Section 163 of the Dodd-Frank Act is amended to remove the asset threshold and replace it with a final determination under section 113.
(b) Section 164 is amended in a similar manner regarding management interlocks.
(c) Section 165 is amended to remove the asset threshold in subsection (a). The text chunk discusses amendments to sections of the Dodd-Frank Act, removing asset thresholds and replacing them with final determinations under section 113.
